summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) attorneys discussing the drafting and approval of a 'Sharing Order Part II' related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The correspondence focuses on ensuring the order accurately describes trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys for sharing with other parties.

events.title: Drafting of Epstein Sharing Order Part II
events.description: Attorneys at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York exchange emails to review and finalize a sharing order application for trust and will documents received from Epstein's estate attorneys.

events.title: Follow-up on Sharing Order Approval
events.description: An attorney follows up on the previous day's email chain to check if colleagues have signed off on the sharing order and asks if it can be sent to 'Part I' (likely another legal team or division) that day or the next.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively working on a legal document called 'Epstein Sharing Order Part II' in late January 2020.
The sharing order pertained to 'trust and will documents' received from attorneys representing Jeffrey Epstein's estate over the preceding two weeks.
The correspondence shows internal procedural review, with attorneys checking the accuracy of how newly received estate materials were described before sharing them.
The emails reference that the documents 'doesn't appear to include revocations,' indicating a specific legal detail was under scrutiny.
The communication is professional and focused on the technical drafting and approval of a court-related sharing order.
